alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 09 at 6:57PM EST until December 09 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Monroe County in south central Kentucky... Southwestern Cumberland County in south central Kentucky... * Until 630 PM CST. * At 556 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Red Boiling Springs, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Tompkinsville, Gamaliel, Meshack, Forkton, Blythe, Harlan Crossroads, Freetown, Vernon, Peytonsburg and Stalcup. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for south central Kentucky. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for south central Kentucky.
